page.title: 16Skegness Aerodrome
page.content: The Skegness Aerodrome is on the A52 road between Butlin's Camp and Ingoldmells village.It was built in 1948 and was part of Butlin's.They gave pleasure flights to the campers, so it was a great attraction.In 1951 Skegness Air Taxi Service took over. They formed an Aero Club which gave flying lessons.They still own it. Sometimes they do an aerial crop inspection and check that there are no power lines broken or gas pipes being ploughed up.Also besides aerial photo- graphy they do a taxi service. For instance to go to Manchester costs Â£180.When Class 4 went to visit the airfield we saw the plane which tows the advertising banner.It was in the hanger together with some privately owned aircraft.The fire tender was standing ready in case of accidents. A helicopter landed and took off.
